author: Dr Ben Miles
description:
Scientists at EPFL have converted discarded langoustine shells into bio-hybrid robot actuators capable of carrying 200 times their own weight. These biodegradable components offer a sustainable approach for developing soft robotics and underwater systems. 

This kind of makes me uncomfortable...

Source Article: https://pubmed.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/41298275/
